column2: PENNSYLVANIA DMV DRIVING TEST
column4: Pennsylvania

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text

column2: 1. If a traffic light is broken or not functioning you should:
column4: proceed as you normally would.
column6: stop and wait for a licensed traffic technician to arrive.
column8: stop and wait for it to turn green.
column10: continue as if it was a four-way stop sign.

column2: 2. What should you do in case of a brake failure?
column4: Rub your tires on the curb to slow your car.
column8: Pull off the road into an open space, if available.

column2: 3. Regulation signs normally are:
column4: blue rectangles.

column2: 4. When making a right turn on a green light, drivers must:
column4: yield to pedestrians.
column6: stop and look for oncoming traffic.

column2: 5. These pavement markings tell you that at the intersection ahead:
column4: you can only turn right from the center lane.
column6: the center lane mergers into one lane.
column8: center lane traffic may go straight or turn left.
column10: center lane traffic must turn left.

column2: 6. In Pennsylvania the top major crash type for 16 year old drivers is:
column4: driving in reverse on a side street.

column2: 7. When driving on slick roads, drivers should:
column4: take turns more slowly.
column8: drive as they would on dry roads.

column2: 8. A flashing red light:
column4: means the same thing as a stop sign.
column6: means that you must bring your vehicle to a complete halt.

column2: 9. This sign tells drivers:
column4: turning right on red is forbidden.
column6: they may not turn right or left during the red light.
column8: they must wait for the traffic signal to turn green before turning right or left.

column2: 10. Road signs that point out scenic areas and parks are:
column4: brown and white.

column2: 11. This road sign means:
column4: There is a traffic signal ahead

column2: 12. The law gives _______ the right of way at intersections.
column4: drivers going straight

column2: 13. People under 16 years of age who use a false identification card to buy alcohol will:
column4: receive a driving suspension that starts on their 16th birthday.
column6: never be able to take the driver’s exam.
column8: receive a driving suspension that starts on their 21st birthday.
column10: be forced to attend an Alcohol Education class.

column2: 14. To reduce your risk of being involved in a traffic crash, the most effective thing you can do is:
column4: Only driving between 11:00 AM and 4:00 PM
column6: Limiting your driving to week days.
column10: Driving in the right lane on multi-lane highways.

column2: 15. You reach an intersection controlled by a stop sign, and can’t get a good view of cross-street traffic when you stop behind the white top bar painted on the pavement. You should:
column4: wait until the fastest vehicles have passed, then proceed.
column6: pull forward slowly, check for traffic and pedestrians, and proceed when clear.
column8: check for traffic on the right, then proceed.

column2: 16. At a stop sign there is no stop line, you must stop:
column4: after you enter the crosswalk.
column8: before the traffic light turns red.

column2: 17. A flashing yellow traffic signal means:
column4: Slow down and be alert at the upcoming intersection.
column8: The same thing as a stop sign.
column10: Stop and proceed when a green light appears.

column2: 18. A sign with this shape means:
column4: You must yield the right-of-way
